Subject: Strange dip in results with SharpNEAT

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hi all,

I'm working on a simple robot foraging task in SharpNEAT and we're seeing a
very strange result. The agents seem to be improving in fitness for the
first ~250 generations and then they dip in performance for ~150
generations before climbing back up again and plateauing:
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/20857495/longrun.png

Note that the graph there is an average over 30 trials. We've repeated the
experiment across machines and agent configurations, and we keep seeing
this strange dip.

The world has a bunch of food that's randomly scattered at every
generation, and we've double-checked our code including writing unit tests,
so we're fairly confident that it's not a bug of some kind in our
simulator. One thing worth noting is that the maximum fitness in this
domain is 3000, so we're wondering if maybe this could be the result of
something SharpNEAT is doing when fitness stagnates. We're using the
default NEAT parameters with the exception of starting with fully-connected
networks. I thought it may be due to the FitnessHistoryLength, but setting
that to 0 doesn't change anything either.

Has anyone seen anything like this before? Colin, maybe you can offer a
hypothesis about what in SharpNEAT could cause this?

Wesley

--bcaec54fb9e0aa024b04b464dd59
